xxl.core.io.fat.util
Class StringOperations

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.fat.util.StringOperations

public class StringOperations
extends java.lang.Object

This class supports operations on strings. Like extract the name of a file from a complete path string.

Constructor Detail

StringOperations

public StringOperations()
Method Detail

extractFileName

public static java.lang.String extractFileName(java.lang.String completePath)
Return the name of the file of completePath that is the suffix of completePath. If no file separator and no ":" exists the completePath string will be returned. The complete path string is allowed to contain a device name but it don't has to. In case there is a device name with a file separator but no file or directory name the empty string is returned. In case there is a ":" in completePath everything until this ":" is treated as device name.

Parameters:
completePath - a path to a file with or without device name.
Returns:
the last component of completePath seperated by "\" or the empty string if no such component exist.

extractDeviceName

public static java.lang.String extractDeviceName(java.lang.String completePath)
Return the name of the device of completePath that is the prefix of completePath until and inclusive the first occurence of ":" in case of a win32 system. If the system is unix the returned device looks like "/dev/X", where X is a variable for the unix name of the device like "fd0" for the first floppy, or "hda0" for the first disk. If no device name exists the empty string is returned. In case the device name contained in the complete path doesn't point to a physical device the ":" is used to cut the device name from the rest of the path, this is system independant.

Parameters:
completePath - a path to a file with or without device name.
Returns:
the system dependant device name or the empty string if no such component exist.

extractPath

public static java.lang.String extractPath(java.lang.String completePath)
Return the path of completePath. The String completePath is allowed to contain a device name like 'a:', or 'c:' but it don't has to. In case the completePath String is only a file name the system dependant file separator ("\\" for win32, or "/" for unix) is returned, which indicates the root directory. In case completePath doesn't contain a path the string "\\" on win32 systems or "/" on unix system, is returned.

Parameters:
completePath - a path to a file with or without device name.
Returns:
the path of completePath only, that is the string after the ":" exclusive the first "\" until and exclusive the last component of completePath or the empty string if no such component exist.

removeDeviceName

public static java.lang.String removeDeviceName(java.lang.String completePath)
Return the complete path without the device name, the backslash at the beginning is also removed. If completePath consists only of a device name the empty string is returned.

Parameters:
completePath - a path to a file with or without device name.
Returns:
the completePath removed of the deviceName or the completePath itself if no deviceName exist.

extractNumericTail

public static long extractNumericTail(java.lang.String fileName)
Extract the numeric tail of the given file name. The numeric tail is the number after the '~'. If no such number exist zero is returned.

Parameters:
fileName - name of a file or directory
Returns:
the numeric tail of the given fileName or zero if no such number exist.
